edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.otBatch.otExtension

Class OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.ot.otBatch.otExtension.OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OTBatchReceiver, Covert, Malicious, OneSidedSimulation, ProtocolSecLevel, SecurityLevel, SemiHonest

    public class OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements Malicious, OTBatchReceiver
    A concrete class for Malicious OT extension receiver.

    The base OT is done once in the construction time. After that, the transfer function will be always optimized and fast, no matter how much OT's there are.

    There are three versions of OT extension: General, Correlated and Random. The difference between them is the way of getting the inputs:

    In general OT extension both x0 and x1 are given by the user.

    In Correlated OT extension the user gives a delta array and x0, x1 arrays are chosen such that x0 = delta^x1.

    In random OT extension both x0 and x1 are chosen randomly.

    To allow the user decide which OT extension's version he wants, each option has a corresponding input class.

    The particular OT extension version is executed according to the given input instance; For example, if the user gave as input an instance of OTExtensionRandomRInput than the random OT Extension will be execute.

    NOTE: Unlike a regular implementation, the connection is done via the native code and thus the channel provided in the transfer function is ignored.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Meital Levy, Asaf Cohen)

    • Constructor Detail

      • OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver

        public OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                            int serverPort,
                            int numOfThreads,
                            int numBaseOts,
                            int numOts)
        A constructor that creates the native receiver with communication abilities.

        It uses the ip address and port given in the party object.

        The construction runs the base OT phase. Further calls to transfer function will be optimized and fast, no matter how much OTs there are.

        Parameters:
        serverAddress - the ip of the other sender
        serverPort - the port of the other sender
        numBaseOts - to use in the ot protocol
        numOts - to do in parallel.

      • OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver

        public OTExtensionMaliciousReceiver(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                            int serverPort,
                            int numOts)
        Default constructor. Initializes the receiver by passing the ip address and uses koblitz 163 as a default dlog group.

        The construction runs the base OT phase. Further calls to transfer function will be optimized and fast, no matter how much OTs there are.

        Parameters:
        serverAddress - the ip address of the sender
        serverPort - the port of the sender
        numOts - to do in the ot in parallel.

    • Method Detail

      • transfer

        public OTBatchROutput transfer(Channel channel,
                      OTBatchRInput input)
        The overloaded function that runs the protocol.

        After the base OT was done by the constructor, call to this function will be optimized and fast, no matter how much OTs there are.

        Specified by:
        transfer in interface OTBatchReceiver
        Parameters:
        channel - Disregarded. This is ignored since the connection is done in the c++ code.
        input - The input for the receiver specifying the version of the OT extension to run. Every call to the transfer function can run a different OT extension version.
        Returns:
        OTBatchROutput, the output of the protocol.

      • releaseResources

        public void releaseResources()
        Deletes the native OT object. This function MUST be called after the OT is finished!!! The user of this class SHOULD NOT wait for the finalize() function, since we don't know when the garbage collector will collect this class.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Deletes the native OT object, ideally the resources were already released explicitly.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
